thread.title: Mason Noise replaces Tom Bleasby on X Factor
thread.title_full: Mason Noise replaces Tom Bleasby on X Factor

title: Mason Noise replaces Tom Bleasby on X Factor
text:
Grimmy brings back Mason Noise after Tom Bleasby quits X Factor 15/10/15 
Mason Noise will replace X Factor contestant Tom Bleasby after he pulled out of the competition. 
Nick Grimshaw announced he was bringing back Mason despite the fact he was kicked off the show for bad behaviour. 
The 21-year-old from Birmingham dropped his microphone and walked off stage after complaining about not getting enough screen time. 
He also argued with Simon Cowell before Grimmy revealed he had wanted to give him one of his six chairs. 
Earlier this week Bleasby had chosen to withdraw "due to personal reasons". 
He told ITV: "I just don't know if I felt vocally ready to take on the competition and the pressure." If he kicked off and he wasn't talented then he'd be out the door, but he can really sing Nick Grimshaw 
On Sunday's show the 19-year-old from Leeds won a place in Nick's final six boys. 
Initially Bleasby had actually lost his chair to Ben Clark but Nick Grimshaw changed his mind after the crowd began chanting to bring him back. Image caption Grimmy faced having only five boys or bringing one back 
It's been a chaotic week of X Factor coming and goings. 
Mason previously made rude comments about Simon Cowell, Cheryl Fernandez-Fersini and has been booed by the crowd. 
Grimshaw announced Mason's comeback on his breakfast show saying: "It had to be Mason, he's going to judge's houses. I just thought he was exciting." 
"People do kick off, but if he kicked off and he wasn't talented then he'd be out the door, but he can really sing," he explained. 
"He's got an idea of who he wants to be and that's good for me. Let's focus on the music," he says. 
Some argue it's the latest sign producers are trying to improve X Factor's falling ratings. 
But Nick Grimshaw will now be taking the maximum number of six boys on to the judge's houses stage. 
Tom Bleasby's departure came a week after he appeared on Ellen DeGeneres's US chat show to talk about his virtual duet with Jessie J. 
He used a karaoke app to make it look like he was singing with Jessie. 
The YouTube clip has been watched more than 11 million times since it was posted in May. 
Ellen surprised Tom on her show by bringing on Jessie as he began to sing Flashlight.
